results.title: Lands apart
results.brief_description: In this story Cathy tells the story of her parents who migrated to Australia and thanks them ” for your strength and the sacrifices you made to give us a better life” Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: It's never too late
results.brief_description: Maria claims that her first day in this country in 1959 was ‘magic’ but that in her new life everyone had to work hard and there was no time for lighthearted things. However in 1995 she experienced a change in life that taught her “It’s never too late”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Growing up overnight
results.brief_description: Joe migrated in 1959 when he was 13 years old and became his family’s main wage earner less than a year later when his father lost a leg. In this story Joe gives us a glimpse of his experience since then saying his life is now “enjoying every day which is filled with friends and family”. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Emilio's story
results.brief_description: In 1952 Emilio left his family behind in Italy to come and earn money in Australia. He didn’t see them again until they came to join him 9 years later. Instead of a place to become rich and leave, Australia became his home. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Australia: per forza e per amore
results.brief_description: Giovanni was working on an olive farm as a teenager when he was suddenly called home - he was leaving for Australia in 2 hours! In this story he tells of his life since that day and how he became a political figure in his new homeland. Created as part of the Racconti: La Voce del Popolo Digital Storytelling in association with The Italian Federation of Migrant Workers and their Families (FILEF).

results.title: Thaumatropes
results.brief_description: A thaumatrope is an optical toy that binds a disc to lengths of string. Illustrated on each side of the disc are distinct images that become one when you pull the string and the thaumatrope spins.

constellations_primary.name: There's always a lighthouse
constellations_primary.description: The thaumatrope was an early optical illusion device popular in the Victorian era and was important to the development of the moving image.

results.description: How do you cage a bird? With a thaumatrope, an optical toy that binds a disc to lengths of string. Illustrated on each side of the disc are distinct images that become one when you pull the string and the thaumatrope spins. The first known thaumatrope was invented by John Ayrton Paris in 1824, when he used it to demonstrate his theory of ‘persistence of vision’ to London’s Royal College of Physicians.
description_for_label: How do you cage a bird? With a thaumatrope, an optical toy that binds a disc to lengths of string. Illustrated on each side of the disc are distinct images that become one when you pull the string and the thaumatrope spins. The first known thaumatrope was invented by John Ayrton Paris in 1824, when he used it to demonstrate his theory of ‘persistence of vision’ to London’s Royal College of Physicians.

group_works.title: La Lanterne Magique (The Magic Lantern) thaumatrope

results.title: The Coolangatta Gold
results.creator_credit: Michael Edgley International, Hoyts, John Weiley and Igor Auzins
results.brief_description: A young son is filled with burning resentment at being forced to live in his brother’s shadow. His brother is burdened by their father’s desire for glory. Their father is obsessed by the need to redeem his own failure twenty years before. A dramatic story of family conflict which culminates in the spectacular excitement of the greatest beach and surf triaquathon in the world, the Coolangatta Gold. Both brothers enter the race, one to win for his father, one bent to beat his father. To do so, they must also compete against each other. Cast: Joss McWilliam, Nick Tate, Robyn Nevin, Josephine Smulders, Colin Friels.

holdings.name: VHS; Access Print (Section 1)

results.title: [The funeral of Field Marshal Sir Thomas Blamey]
results.brief_description:
This film contains documentary footage of the state funeral of Field Marshal Sir Thomas Blamey, which took place on 30 May, 1951 in Melbourne, Victoria.

The film captures the funeral cortege as it proceeds along Swanston Street, with crowds of people lining the streets and buildings. The flag-covered casket is accompanied by a military band, soldiers and dignitaries. Significant public figures marching in the cortege include Prime Minister Robert Menzies, Governor-General William McKell, Governor of Victoria Sir Dallas Brooks and Chief Justice of the High Court Sir John Latham.

The film includes wonderful footage of Swanston Street from a high vantage point with the Shrine of Remembrance in the distance. There are also great shots of soldiers marching together, military horses, people gathered in front of the Melbourne City Baths and a couple watching on atop the facade of the ‘W.H. Terry Memorial Hall’.

An estimated 300,000 people turned out to watch the funeral procession, which travelled from the Shrine of Remembrance, along St Kilda Road, and up Swanston Street to College Crescent, before proceeding by car to Fawkner Crematorium.

Sir Thomas Blamey (24 Jan 1884 – 27 May 1951) was a General in the Australian army and the only Australian to have achieved the rank of Field Marshal.

results.title: Emotions of everyday living: the steps of age
results.creator_credit: Ben Maddow, Helen Levitt and Film Documents
results.brief_description: A discussion of the problems confronting old age. The effect of inactivity on the lives of a crane-driver and his wife after his retirement are shown.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
